Nothing more than a skeleton, picked clean by the rats. B he still bears his leather armor, and a horned helmet tha resembles his father's own. Conan takes the helmet and places it on his head. It fits perfectly.
Tamara is gingerly making her way through the knee high sewage water and the dead bodies submerged within.
Oh!!! Tamara leaps up, swinging the torch down towards the wate Conan, nearby, unsheathes his sword.
What?
Something touched me. Something slimy. Conan walks over, the torchlight revealing something on Tamara's leg. It's a SLUG, which he flicks off.
Crom! Stop wasting time. But when Conan steps forward, something ROILS THE WATER r before him. He spots a HUGE TENTACLE just before its submerges back into the water.

Crom indeed. Then Tamara SCREAMS as another tentacle rises up from the water, wrapping around her waist. Tamara grabs hold of th wall as the tentacle tries to pull her underwater. Conan immediately SLASHES the tentacle, pulling Tamara aw The squirming decapitated tentacle squirts black blood everywhere, the knee high water seems to come alive with roiling intensity. Conan spins, finding a circular stone staircase tiled int the far cistern wall. 83.
Let's go.
As they work their way up the circular stairwell, towards thin shaft of firelight up ahead.

Carved out of solid black rock, both sides of the broad corridor are occasionally punctuated by thick steel doors leading to prison cells. Conan and Tamara emerge from a sewer drain, pushing their to the floor of the hallway. The heavy darkness presses i Conan's torch like a sentient, animate thing. The floor of the corridor is lined with DEAD BODIES, in varying states of decay. There are buckets, filled with entrails and feces, upended. Tamara put her hand over her mouth. Conan continues down the hallway. He and Tamara begin to the sound of EERIE CHANTING.
What is that? Up ahead, the torch-lined dungeon plunges into darkness a the torches end. Conan holds up his own torch, struggling peer into the black void.

Nothing good. Conan takes a step forward when suddenly a POWERFUL WIND blows out his torch. A moment later, there's the sound of GATE WHISTLING DOWN AND CRASHING INTO THE GROUND. In the darkness, comes a DEEP, EARTHY CHUCKLE.
Welcome. A HOST OF OIL LIGHTS SUDDENLY COME UP, revealing that the gate that closed behind them was actually just a door to vast CAGE built around a massive PIT. 84.

The same pit where Fariq sacrificed the female monk, only now, a half dozen COMBATANTS stand on the grid above the void. Hanging high above the pit, in baskets, lie other PRISONE including Tamara's fellow female monks. Several of them Y out Tamara's name as they see her. And watching everything, from an amphitheater above the c is the massive Akhun and several of his slavers.
Which ever one of you slaves gets me the girl, lives. The Combatants all close in on Conan and Tamara, each tak a different plank way to get to them.
Stay behind me. Tamara steps behind Conan, who blocks the others' path to her.

Who dies first? The first two COMBATANTS attack as one, the first wieldin short sword, the other a pike. The pikeman thrusts first, Conan deftly stepping aside, then pulling the pike, sendi the wielder off balance and into the abyss. The prisoner with the short sword doesn't fare much bette as Conan evades his swipe and decapitates him with a sing blow.
Tamara sees that the prisoner baskets are suspended by th top half of the metallic cage. She begins scaling the cag her eyes set upon the imprisoned monks.

Three more COMBATANTS step in to replace the fallen duo. Conan readies himself as the first one steps up, only to the combatant suddenly grabbed by a ENORMOUS TENTACLE, mu like the one Conan cut through earlier.

Up from the darkness of the pit comes a gargantuan monste gigantic octopus-like behemoth, with multiple tentacles t feed a pulsing black orifice lined with razor sharp teeth The creature reaches out and grabs another SCREAMING combatants, lowering him to its mouth and devouring him i its gnashing maw. The creature reaches for Conan, who ducks underneath the tentacle, the slices it off. He immediately turns back to check on Tamara -- and he discovers she's not there. He looks up to see Tamara scaling the cage, now nearly fi feet directly above him.
Crom!
The massive warrior spots Tamara getting close to the prisoner baskets and motions to his two Jailers.
Get her!
She's reached the base of the chain supporting one of the baskets when she spots the two Jailers closing in, climbi towards her from either side.
Spotting Tamara overhead, Conan tries to keep beneath her evading the swarming tentacles while balancing on the ric planks.
She's scaling down the basket supporting chain when the f Jailer reaches out to grab her. She reacts by GASHING his eyes, and as he instinctively grabs them, he FALLS TOWARD THE PIT.

Conan barely dives out of the way as the fallen Jailer SMASHES through the plank he was on, forcing Conan to jum another. Just then another COMBATANT comes swinging for the Cimmer forcing him to defend while still not balanced. 86.
The next Jailer grabs her, pulling her off the cage. He struggles to pull towards a nearby exit hatch when she BI HIS EAR OFF. The Jailer drops Tamara, who SCREAMS as she falls.

Conan spots Tamara plunging towards him. In one swift mov he SLASHES his opponent, ducks underneath a writhing tentacle, and reaches out to GRAB TAMARA BY THE ARM AS SH FALLS. His shoulder nearly pops out, but he manages to ho onto Tamara.
She swings above the chasm, the gnashing teeth of the mon below her. Only a single splintering plank holds her and Conan aloft.
With a grunt, he swings Tamara and throws her to safety, the edge of the pit. But as he gets to his feet, he spots the massive Akhun entering the arena.

The giant warrior grins as he boards the same plank as Co He thrusts his thunderous legs down, causing the plank to bend and warp. Conan struggle to balance on the undulating plank, but hi training in Cimmeria serves him well. Akhun smiles and step closer, again thrusting down with h legs. Conan's balance is thrown, but there's no other pla close enough for him to jump to.

You'll make a nice meal. Akhun steps down on the plank one last time, but this tim Conan uses the momentum to SPRINGBOARD UP INTO AIR. Conan soars into the air, his cat-like reflexes keeping h focused as he lands right before the stunned Akhun. With great slash of his blade, Conan eviscerates Akhun. 87. Akhun's innards drop out of his belly as he falls into th abyss, only to be snapped up by the massive beast.

Conan lowers down the last of the baskets. Tamara use a s to smash open the lock, freeing the prisoners inside. Tamara shares hugs of joy with the other monks of her flo The women look worn, but unbroken.
Where is Ilira?
She was taken away by Fariq.
Then I'm too late. One of the stronger looking women, an ELDER MONK, steps forward.

No. She was just taken this morning. It's not yet midnight, and Khalar still must bring her to the cave of Acheron. Tamara nods and the women begin to ARM THEMSELVES. Conan shakes his head at the rag-tag group.
You're going to fight Khalar's troops? Just you? The Elder Monk grabs and nearby pike and twirls it expert about her body, clearly well versed in it use.
Cimmerians aren't the only women who know how to fight. And to kill. Tamara looks at the other monks.
Our duty was to keep the queen safe. We failed. But if Khalar brings her to Acheron, it will rise again -- and all our peoples' sacrifice is for nothing.
So if the queen is not free by the stroke of midnight -- she must be already dead. The other monks nod and they start to head off. Tamara is last to head off, her eyes burning into Conan's.
You want my help again.
No. You kept your word, I'll keep mine. I pray you fulfill your debt. Tamara kisses Conan's cheek one last time and heads off.
The monk travel in single file, the Elder Monk leading th way. Suddenly, she stops, motioning to an entranceway ahe
Guard.
Don't kill him. We need to find out which way Ilira was taken. The Elder Monk nods and slips up ahead. We hear a SMASH.
The stunned GUARD lies before the assembled monks. Tamara glares down at him.
Tell us where the last girl was taken. The Guard just LAUGHS at them through bloody teeth.
Let me ask. The Guard's face drops as Conan steps out from the darkne
Your debt -- 89.
Will be where your queen is. Tamara smiles. She knows it is a half truth.
As Conan and the monks enter, the throne room is empty, scattered light barely illuminating the expansive chamber Ilira sits on the throne, crown on her slumped head. Tama runs over to her.
Ilira! She raises Ilira's head, only to discover lifeless eyes. Tamara cradles her best friend's face.
She's dead. It's over.

Not yet. Before the monks can react, ARROWS STREAK OUT FROM THE DARKNESS, killing them all. Only Conan is quick enough to dodge his arrow by diving aside. When he comes up, Khalar has Tamara, his sword at her nec Several ARCHERS stand behind him, at the ready.
It's only begun. Because that one was not the heir to Acheron. Khalar smiles down at Tamara.
She is. Slowly, what he's saying dawns on her.
No. It can't be --
Secretive, the traitors of Acheron. It wasn't easy, but Fariq finally wrung honesty from the girl. That poor innocent was forced to live a lie, even as the truth was kept from the queen herself.
And you did the rest, barbarian. My thanks for delivering the Queen to me.
No! Suddenly, a trap door opens beneath Conan and drops down the darkness, landing with a heavy THUD.

Conan awakens to the familiar sound of a hot blade SIZZLI as it hits the cooling vat. But this is no dream of his father's forge -- as he looks to see Fariq holding a sword, its tip still red hot, the flames of the fortress's forge behind him. Conan's thrusts forward, only to find his armed chained around a heavy mortar and stone pillar. Fariq strokes his newly acquired scar.
At last you awaken, Cimmerian. It's been hours you've made me wait for my fun. Conan says nothing, but his eyes scan the room, taking in everything.
You made me lose face in front of my father. That wasn't wise. But what should I expect from a Cimmerian?
A swift end! Conan strains at the chain, ripping the skin beneath his shackles -- but a thin wisp of mortar comes loose from th pillar.
Hardly. But that is a difference between you and me. A swift end would be a mercy I do not intend to grant. No, you must suffer for your transgressions.
You must beg for your suffering to end. Just as your people did. He waves the glowing sword tip in front of Conan's face.
You lie. I was there. My father never uttered a sound. Fariq LAUGHS, amused.

You were there? What were you doing, warrior? Watching your father die, without saying a sound? Taking your eyes will be justice indeed, coward. Fariq pushes the hot tip of the sword against Conan's ski Conan's face reddens with pain, but he doesn't utter a so But as Conan pulls on his chains -- more mortar falls. As Fariq turns back to place the sword in the forge, Conan notices one of the bricks the chains are fastened to is LOOSE.
I saw my father die. Slain by one who can only kill men already on their knees. Fariq turns, his eyes blazing. He glances over at the two GUARDS by the door, who try not to listen.
I've killed many in battle, cur.

Really? Then why did your father not let you face me before, when I had sword in hand. He thought you unequal to the task. Fariq responds by pushing the red hot blade against Conan chest. Conan just YELLS back at him.
Coward! Prove your strength! Again, Fariq pushes the hot blade against Conan's skin.

Take my eyes, coward -- if you can. 92. Fariq yells and thrust the tip of the sword at Conan's he Conan lifts his manacles, forcing the blade up into the b holding his chain. Then Conan pulls on the chains with all his might, loosen the heavy brick, which falls to the ground. In one powerful movement, Conan begins SWINGING the chain with the mortar block on the end, a homemade ball and cha The two Guards come forward, sword drawn, only to meet wi CRUNCHING blow by Conan's weapon. Both their heads get ca in. Fariq rushes Conan, getting in too close for Conan's wide swings. Conan simply meets Fariq's sword with the heavy chains, then encircles Fariq's neck with the steel bonds. Fariq CHOKES, falling to the ground, gasping for air. But Conan doesn't kill him -- yet.
A vat of molten steel bubbles in a cauldron within the fo Conan uses tongs to lift the cauldron out.

Conan kicks him onto his back. Fariq's last vision is tha Conan, tipping the cauldron, the hot iron descending towa his eyes. Fariq SCREAMS. Conan reaches down and picks up Fariq's sword. THE SWORD CONAN'S FATHER MADE FOR HIM.

By torchlight, Khalar Singh leads his black-armored PERSO GUARD, two dozen men strong, across a rocky peninsula, jutting out into the sea. On the back of Khalar's horse, bound, rides the helpless Tamara. As they round a large rock spire they spy a fearsome and inspiring sight. A massive SKULL, seemingly a natural roc formation, rises over the peninsula. As they ride closer, we can make out one more detail -- t mouth of the skull is actually a massive door, at least s feet high, and seemingly made up of jagged bone. It has t appearance of teeth, completing the skull illusion. 93.

It takes the full complement of soldiers to open the enor doors. Khalar Singh rides in. Moonlight from the huge eye the skull illuminate terrifying faces in the darkness. Fa of demonic warrior statues. At their feet lie the decaying bones of human skeletons, numerous to count.
This is no empire, only a graveyard.

You see only with your eyes. Khalar nods to his men. Two Guardsmen take their torches light other torches set in the walls. It sets off a chain reaction. As far as the eye can see torches ignite reveal the true scope of this place. An enormous cave, the walls lined with monumental columns that frame countless bas relief carvings of demonic origi And at the far of the cave, an ALTAR sits beneath a raise THRONE, surrounded by a SACRIFICIAL POOL. The pool is emp Khalar turns to his guards.
Close the gates and stay here. Send my son to me when he arrives. (motioning to two of them) You two, come with me.
Khalar dismounts at the sacrificial altar, carved of out purple-shaded rock. Around its edges are deep channels, f the blood of its victims. And on its four corners -- shac of bone.

The Acheronians had a wonderful sense of balance, don't you think? For one to ascend to royalty, another must fall. With the flick of a wrist, Khalar cuts Tamara's bonds. 94. Tamara head butts him, struggling to escape, but Khalar absorbs the blow effortlessly. He throws Tamara upon the altar, his two guards shackling her in place.

For a hundred generations the kings of Acheron were crowned, and the queens were sacrificed. Khalar snaps his fingers and two guardsmen bring an ornat carved BOX MADE OF BONE, laying it before the altar. Like Chinese puzzle box, Khalar manipulates the carvings of skulls, sacrifices, and creatures until the box UNLATCHES And from the box he lifts two items. A CROWN OF GOLD and CROWN OF IRON. The crown of gold is magnificent, ornately detailed gold that glows in the firelight. But the crown of iron is terrifying. Huge rough spikes ex from it in every direction. It looks more like a weapon t a crown.
What a day for you. This morning you were a handmaiden. Tonight, you are a queen giving birth to an empire.

Bloodied and weary, Conan approaches the Skull Rock. He h nothing more than his sword, his loincloth and a small BU SACK tied to his hip. He stumbles, falling to his knees. His wounds have taken grave toll. Still he stands and presses on. He pushes on the doors. They do not budge in the least. H puts his shoulder to the doors -- his every muscle strain to their utmost. Again -- no movement. Conan backs away, taking stock of the surroundings. He cl up the side of the rock.
Khalar Singh CHANTS in Acheronian. Ancient, harsh words, he lifts the two crowns overhead, offering them to the statues of dark gods all around. 95.
Stop. You don't know what you are about to do.

But I do. For thirty years I have dreamed of this day. The day our people rise from the ashes. Khalar Singh continues his chant and places the gold crow upon his head. As he does so, the light from the moon reflects off the crown, bathing the sacrificial pool in a unnatural glow. THUMP-THUMP. A deep and foreboding sound echoes throughou the cave, shaking everything like an earthquake. It sound like the heartbeat of a giant. Khalar next places the iron crown around Tamara's head. S thrashes and struggles but to no avail. Once the crown is around her head -- THUMP-THUMP! The spi around the iron crown grow shorter AS THE SPIKES DRIVE THEMSELVES INTO HER HEAD. She SCREAMS in agony. Blood drips from beneath the crown, flowing into channels around the edges of the altar.
It begins. You give birth to an empire.
Conan climbs -- muscles straining -- slipping -- hanging by one hand -- and climbing again. THUMP-THUMP. The statuary shakes, indeed the whole earth does. Conan nearly slips, but keeps his grip.
Crom. He reaches the eye of the skull.
With the moon over his shoulder, Conan stares down at the unholy sight before him. We pull back revealing Tamara, h blood draining from her body. 96.
Tamara, her face pale from blood loss, begins to pray in pained whispers.
It's good that you pray. Gods will be here soon. Tamara struggles to speak, her body wracked with pain.
He'll--be---here--sooner.
Who?

Me! Khalar turns to see the outline of Conan, framed by the moonlight, looking down at Khalar from atop of one the warrior statues. A thick vine dangles nearby, Conan's rou down from the cave roof above. Conan then leaps down to the skeleton covered floor befor the altar. It is a killing floor. The two Guardsmen leap for him, but Conan dispatches them with a pair of strikes. Both fall down dead. Conan meets Tamara's eyes, a look of determination, assurance. He starts toward the altar.
I will say this for you, barbarian. You are hard to kill.
Let her go.
You've faced me before and lost. What do you think has changed now?
My purpose. Conan lunges for Khalar, their swords meeting with a flas sparks. They fight to a brief standstill when ---THUMP, THUMP.

Tamara writhes in pain as the spikes drive deeper into he head. More blood pours forth. The blood in the channels speeds up and finds the channel leading down to the sacrificial pool. Conan makes another movement toward the altar, but Khalar nimbly blocks his path.
You are strong, Cimmerian, but we both know you are not my equal. Conan takes the burlap sack wrapped at his hip pulls it o
Once you used my father to teach your son a lesson about strength. Now let me teach you. Conan tosses out what is inside. It falls to the ground, rolling to Khalar Singh's feet.
Khalar looks down at the ground -- at the head of his bel son, his eyes gone, replaced by molten metal. Khalar trem in shock and rage.
No. Khalar reaches for the severed head, giving Conan a brief window to rush to Tamara's side. Conan tries to lift her the altar, but the bone shackles still pin her down.

Cimmerian!!! Enraged, Khalar CHARGES Conan throwing all his skill and force into an all-out attack. Conan simply sidesteps it, shatters the bone shackle holding one of Tamara's wrists. Before he can shatter the other, Khalar charges again. Khalar swings, Conan spins, his blade catching Khalar's j inches from his face. Conan throws Khalar off him, knocki the warlord back ten feet. Khalar's attack is feral, uncontrolled. He's lost his balance. Spinning and striking blindly, Conan smashes the second shackle on her wrist. He continues his motion, bringing h sword around to meet Khalar's next strike. 98. Now Khalar looks like the enraged amateur, and Conan the polished warrior. Their battle takes them away from the altar. With her hands free, Tamara struggles to pull the spikes and remove the crown.

Conan repels another Khalar attack, this time striking Khalar's chest and drawing blood. The Guardsmen arrive fr the other side of the cave, drawing their swords. Khalar waves them off, his fury aimed at the Cimmerian.
The Queen. Shackle her!

In agony, Tamara pulls one of the spikes out, then anothe She pushes with all her might, lifting the crown of iron her bloodied head -- When the Guardsmen charge her, pin her down, and force th crown back on. THUMP, THUMP! The crown spikes imbed themselves even deep as Tamara SCREAMS. The blood now fills the channels of th altar. WE FOLLOW the trail of blood, down the side of the altar, a spiral channel around the leg, and in a wide circle aro the altar until reaching the channel's end --

head_text.subj: THE FIRST DROP OF TAMARA'S BLOOD TOUCHES THE SACRIFICIAL

text: POOL. It BOILS instantly, multiplying itself exponentiall bubbling forth and filling the entire pool. AND ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE. A massive earthquake jolts the entire cave.

As Khalar Singh and Conan battle, the ground beneath them the wide cave floor CRACKS and SPLINTERS. THUMP-THUMP! The earthquake intensifies and the entire fl of the cave GIVES WAY, tumbling into an incredible abyss. Conan and Khalar alike grab onto the only rocks they can reach to prevent them from falling further. 99. Conan ends up against one of the walls on the side of the cave. Khalar clings to the rocks on the edge of the sacre pool. Their bodies are illuminated by a fiery glow. They look below, searching for the source of the glow.

Another two hundred feet deep lies the golden spired city ancient Acheron. The cave is but a forechamber, the sligh taste of the true glory and horror of Acheron. And as they stare down into the ancient city, the shadows there MOVE. Is it a trick of the light? No. Whatever the dark forms a they are coming this way, climbing the tallest demonic sp and leaping impossibly far to climb up after Conan and Kh Singh. Khalar gazes down at the city with wide eyes.
Beyond my dreams --
Tamara, her body's blood nearly drained, is still shackle the altar, which now teeters over the edge of chasm, pois to fall into the fiery depths.
Conan!!!
On the other side of the abyss, Conan spots her and scale the cave wall, up to a tiered plateau. He moves quickly, trying to get to Tamara.
Khalar watches, entranced, as the first of the creatures rises out of the pit. They climb the walls like insects, clinging to the walls, their heads swiveling like a prayi mantis.

The look like the statues above -- a hybrid -- part human part demon. Their skin is a perfect black, armor carved o black bone, faces once human but now demonic with blood r eyes and gnashing teeth. 100. They advance on Khalar Singh, who is furthest down now th Conan climbs upward towards Tamara.

I am Khalar Singh, King of Acheron. I command you to kneel! And this demonic horde advances right for him, their razo sharp teeth bared. Unsure, Khalar grips his tulwars tight The demonic creatures draw close, and they -- kneel. They climb out of the abyss and immediately lower their heads before Khalar Singh. Out of the corner of his eye, Khalar spots Conan, drawing near.
Show him the might of the army of Acheron! But they do not rush to follow the order. They stir. One them with more ornate bone armor than the rest looks over Khalar's Guardsmen.
First, we feed. Its voice is somewhere between a whisper and a hiss.
Fine. Take your fill. I will kill him myself.
Conan is on an intercept course with Tamara, leaping acro chasms from statue to statue. Just below him, the first w of Acheronian Warriors reach the Khalar's remaining Guardsmen.

Khalar's Guardsmen, who have been watching the events wit mouths agape, realize the danger too late. The horde of Acheronian Warriors leaps on them and a massive battle en between the demonic warriors and the soldiers.
His climbing is dizzying, reminiscent of his youth scalin the cliffs of Cimmeria. 101.
Intercepts Conan just below the altar, his tulwars at the ready.
Your story ends here. The two warriors square off, fighting even as they cling the statues.
The demon warriors not only slay Khalar's Guardsmen, but their still living bodies apart, dousing themselves in th blood of their victims. It is a violent ritual, both Bacchantic and gruesome.

Launches himself at Conan, his tulwars sparking off the s statuary. Conan leaps to another statue, parrying the blo Khalar overextends himself, and Conan's sword just barely misses his throat. Khalar pulls back, tries to settle himself. Conan's eyes narrow, he knows what Khalar is doing.

Like a woman, Fariq cried and begged me to spare him. Khalar ROARS in rage, launching an all-out offensive. Con backs up slowly, waiting for his moment. And it comes quickly. Conan ducks below the tulwars and C Khalar across the stomach. Khalar loses his balance and falls, one hand grabbing a protruding statue arm, danglin over the abyss. Conan raises his sword to finish the job.

Conan!!! Conan glances down. The Acheronian Commander drank his fi and now moves to the altar itself, his claw stroking Tama body. With one touch, the shackles open. He and the Acheronian Warriors drag her pale body toward the abyss. Khalar grins up at him through bloody teeth. 102.

They take her to a place you can never follow. Who will you fail, Cimmerian? Your father or your woman? Conan leaps down to the altar. The Acheronian Warriors attack. Standing atop the altar, Conan cuts down all come cutting his way through the enemy, working his way to Tam

Tamara!! They leap on Conan, impossibly fast. They stab him. They him. But he does not stop. Even wounded, he throws them i the abyss. And he reaches Tamara, just before the Commander drags he below. He grabs her arm. The Commander grabs her other ar baring his shark-like teeth. BLAM! Conan punches him in the mouth with his free hand a the Commander falls into the abyss. The bloody Conan pulls Tamara up into his arms. Only for Tamara to scream.

Conan! Conan spins just in time as Khalar strikes. Khalar's tulw narrowly misses, and Conan counters. His father's sword r Khalar Singh through. Khalar's body falls into the abyss. But the Acheronian Warriors surround them. Thousands clim out of the abyss, teeth bared, closing in on the wounded Conan. Tamara, badly weakened herself, grabs Conan.
Conan, you know what you must do. Kill me.
No.
It is the only way to end this. My death gives others life.
I cannot. 103.

You must. Your parents both understood that purpose. Now it is yours. Live, Conan. A tear falls from Tamara's face. The demonic warriors pre to strike. Conan drives his sword into Tamara's heart. The crown spi retract and it falls from her head, tumbling into the aby BOOM! A seismic explosion shakes everything, an unearthly GUST OF WIND pulling the Acheronian Warriors back down in the abyss.
The cave begins to fall, massive sections of the roof dropping in to decimate the pyramid and the city below.
Conan pulls Tamara's body away, even as the world descend into dust and debris.

Khalar's HORSE stands near the entrance. Conan puts Tamar body carefully atop the horse, then mounts it himself. He positions her in front of him, his arms encircling her. Conan gives her lifeless body one last kiss, her blood staining his lips red, as his mother's did as a child.

A blazing sun threatens to explode over the nearby mounta Conan holds a single torch in his hand. His look is hard. Grim. We pull back to reveal a funeral pyre, Tamara's body atop Conan places the torch to the pyre. It quickly spreads. We move in, closer and closer upon Conan's ice blue eyes, blazing fire erupting in them. A fire that will never be extinguished.
Live, Conan. Live. FADE TO BLACK.
